name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text: The House Freedom Caucus also has a personal stake in attacking the FBI and DOJ: some of their members asked for pardons, some may be implicated in the January 6th investigation, and their leader had his cell phone seized by investigators probing efforts to overturn the election. https://t.co/H7rY1T1el2

name: Rep. Don Beyer

tweet_text: A Republican majority could use the Holman Rule to try to eliminate the salary of Merrick Garland, Christopher Wray, others in the FBI and DOJ, or zero funding for the FBI‚Äôs DC field office or the USAO-DC to end investigations of Trump -- including the January 6th investigation.

name: Rep. Don Beyer

name: Rep. Don Beyer

It's a 19th century procedural change in the House called the "Holman Rule."

The Holman Rule changed over time, but in its most recent form it allowed the use of must-pass spending bills to eliminate salaries of individual federal employees or to zero funding for a whole office. https://t.co/7gdnccVGud

The truth is there are very strong points in the economy right now, including a historically strong jobs market and the lowest unemployment rate since 1969.

But costs for working people are too high. Democrats are working to lower those costs. Republicans are trying to stop us.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
Republicans want Americans to think the economy is worse than it is, which is why they're screaming "recession."

The recognized authority on recessions - the National Bureau of Economic Research - hasn't said we're in one. And they reject the Republicans' definition of the word. https://t.co/hYN0Xr1uvd

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
While we're talking about basic definitions of economic terms, here's another one Republicans are using to attack the US economy: "recession."

Guess what: we aren't in one!

We added 528,000 jobs last month and consumer spending is strong. That isn't what a recession looks like.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
Does this mean everything is great, we are out of the woods, that no one has any problems because we had zero inflation in July? Of course not, that is ridiculous.

The President said we have more work to do. I said the same. We DO have more work to do. https://t.co/bEbxplubMt

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
If your boss sent you a paycheck for $0.00 at the end of the month and you complained you weren't paid and they replied that your year-over-year pay was $50,000, would you find that convincing? Of course not. Because your monthly pay would be zero.

Inflation in July was zero.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
Media coverage has made this confusing.

When we added 528,000 jobs last month, they didn't say we had added over 6 million jobs year over year. They said we added 528,000 jobs.

The CPI increased over previous months, but it did not increase in July. Inflation in July was zero.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
Republicans and conservative commentators are very upset that we had zero inflation in July this because they want the American economy to fail to hurt Joe Biden.

They point to a year-over-year number showing prices up 8.5% since last July.

But CPI did not increase last month.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
Inflation is a rise in prices of goods and services.

In the United States we measure inflation with the consumer price index (CPI), which combines readings of key costs Americans need to cover like energy, housing, food, etc.

In July the CPI increase was 0.0%.

Zero inflation.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text: The Protecting Our Kids Act was just advanced by the House Judiciary Committee yesterday, setting up votes on the House Floor next week. I strongly support this legislation to prevent gun violence; you can read more about it here: https://t.co/ZuMRZptxce

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text: This builds on other gun violence prevention work in the House. We already passed legislation to require a background check for every gun sale, which I voted for twice. Next week we vote on Extreme Risk Protection Order ("red flag law") legislation I've championed for years.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
The Protecting Our Kids Act also has sections to promote safe storage of guns, a key to responsible gun ownership that the gun debate has long overlooked.

And it would back regulatory actions at ATF to prohibit bump stocks and ghost guns with the force of legislative action.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text: The bill would establish new federal offenses and penalties for straw purchasing and gun trafficking. Many guns used in crimes in cities like Chicago, New York City, and Washington, D.C. are purchased in places with weaker gun restrictions and then transported across state lines.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
The bill would ban high capacity ammunition magazines. 

The man who killed six people and shot 18 others including Congresswoman Gabby Giffords in Tucson was tackled when he had to reload. Just before his 33-round magazine was emptied he shot a 9-year-old girl, killing her.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
It would raise the age to purchase many semiautomatic rifles - including AR-15 models - from 18 to 21. 

I am a cosponsor of the Assault Weapons Ban, and support fully banning these weapons of war from civilian use, but raising the minimum purchase age would also save lives.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
NEW: I signed on as a cosponsor of the Protecting Our Kids Act, broad gun violence prevention legislation introduced in the wake of horrific mass shootings in Uvalde, Buffalo, and elsewhere.

It's one of the most ambitious gun safety reforms in decades; here's what it would do‚Äì

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
But the simple truth here that none of these opponents of gun safety reforms can get away from is that we don't have a monopoly on mental illness, we just have vastly more mass shootings and especially school shootings than other countries.

And we know why. It's the guns.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
Mental health IS a real challenge. I talk about it often. I talked about it during the House Sit-In to prevent gun violence that John Lewis led six years ago.

Over half of US gun deaths are suicides; over half of suicides involve guns. Our gun problem fuels our suicide problem.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
They don't really care about mental health, they just use it as a dodge to take the focus off guns.

Look at it this way: every country in the world has people suffering from mental illness. We don't have 100 times more mental illness in America. What we have is lots of guns.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
They scapegoat people who commit a tiny fraction of our country's gun violence. In the process they scapegoat people with mental illness, which is awful.

If you look you'll often find these exact same lawmakers vote AGAINST mental health resources, and even vote to cut them.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
A word about mental health.

I work on mental health all the time in Congress. I cofounded the House Suicide Prevention Task Force. I've written and passed bills.

Few of those who talk about "mental health" after mass shootings - for instance, right now - actually care about it.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
Two years later we still need to mind the lessons of the CARES Act. The pandemic is still going, and efforts to fight it remain vital.

That means Congress must fund testing and treatment, and efforts to prepare for what may come. We need to pass a new Covid funding measure ASAP.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text:
A key point with the CARES Act was the recognition that our economic recovery was totally dependent on our ability to fight Covid: getting people vaccinations and treatment, and protecting those most at risk. Dozens of economists made this point to me.

And it's still true.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text: The CARES Act kept things from getting much worse, and helped us recover much faster. It's one of the most important and successful pieces of legislation Congress has passed in living memory, and it was totally bipartisan.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text: Subsequent studies have shown that CARES Act measures ‚Äì including unemployment benefits, small business assistance, and public health funding ‚Äì saved lives and played an enormous role in helping avoid far worse damage to American families' livelihoods.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text: America is experiencing an incredibly strong economic recovery, regaining most of the Depression-level job losses the country experienced during the early months of the pandemic with remarkable speed. Look at peer countries and you'll see that progress was far from inevitable.

name: Rep. Don Beyer
tweet_text: Two years ago today the CARES Act was signed into law. Passing CARES was a watershed moment in our response to the pandemic and the recession it caused, it was the centerpiece of Congress‚Äô Covid relief legislation, and I‚Äôm proud to have helped enact it.
